title: Black Holes and Quantum Predictability
abstract: A brief review of the confrontation between black hole physics and quantum-mechanical unitarity is presented. Possibile reconciliations are modifying the laws of physics to allow fundamental loss of information, escape of information during the Hawking process, or black hole remnants. Each of these faces serious objections. A better understanding of the problem and its possible solutions can be had by studying two-dimensional models of dilaton gravity. Recent developments in these investigations are summarized. (Linear superposition of talks presented at the 7th Nishinomiya Yukawa Memorial Symposium and at the 1992 YITP Workshop on Quantum Gravity, November 1992.)
